text: Dorothy Eagle, nee Glasgow (born 1912) was an English editor at the Clarendon Press, who compiled several literary reference works. ==Life== Dorothy Eagle was born on 10 March 1912 in Newcastle upon Tyne. From 1953 until 1978 she was a member of the editorial staff at the Clarendon Press.Library of Congress Name Authority file Her son John (died 2018) was an artist and photographer, who published photo-essays on Irish lighthouses. ==Works== * The Oxford Companion to English Literature * The Oxford Literary Guide to the British Isles, * The Concise Oxford Dictionary of English Literature, Oxford University Press, 1977. * The Oxford Illustrated Dictionary ==References== Category:1912 births Category:Year of death missing Category:English book editors Category:Oxford University Press people
title: Dorothy Eagle
